metadata.title: CVE-2022-36316 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Compliant (focal) - medium
metadata.description:
When using the Performance API, an attacker was able to notice subtledifferences between PerformanceEntries and thus learn whether the targetURL had been subject to a redirect. This vulnerability affects Firefox <103.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-36316` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 103.0+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
firefox-geckodriver - 103.0+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 103.0+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
No subscription required

thunderbird - 1:102.2.2+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:102.2.2+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:102.2.2+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:102.2.2+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:102.2.2+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
xul-ext-lightning - 1:102.2.2+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '103.0+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1').
thunderbird package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:102.2.2+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1').
